question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
One US dollar is the equivalent of 7 Namibian dollars.  One US dollar is also the equivalent of 6 Chinese yuan. If a painting costs 105 Namibian dollars, how much would it cost in Chinese yuan?
inference:
Cost of painting in Namibian Dollars = 105 Namibian Dollars
Cost of 1 Namibian Dollar in US Dollars = 1 Namibian Dollar = 1/7 US Dollars
Cost of painting in US Dollars = 105 Namibian Dollars * (1/7 US Dollars/1 Namibian Dollar)
= 15 US Dollars
Cost of 1 US Dollar in Chinese Yuan = 1 US Dollar = 6 Chinese Yuan
Cost of painting in Chinese Yuan = 15 US Dollars * (6 Chinese Yuan/1 US Dollar)
= 90 Chinese Yuan
Final Answer: \boxed{90}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: Since 7 Namibian dollars ($\text{N}\$$) is equal to 1 US dollar (USD), 105 Namibian dollars is equal to $\text{N}\$105\left(\dfrac{1\;\text{USD}}{\text{N}\$7}\right) = 15\;\text{USD}$. Since 1 US dollar (USD) is equal to 6 Chinese yuan (CNY), 105 Namibian dollars is equal to 15 US dollars is equal to $15\;\text{USD}\left(\dfrac{6\;\text{CNY}}{1\;\text{USD}}\right) = \boxed{90}\;\text{yuan}$.
